sentence.Network_en: Yesterday, the message to him was unequivocal: "Get out."
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天，给他的信息很明确：“滚开。”

sentence.Network_en: On the whole, their tone was unequivocal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的调子基本上是明确的.
报告中传达的信息是明确的。

entry.tran: 毫不含糊的；清楚明白的
entry.def: If you describe someone's attitude as unequivocal, you mean that it is completely clear and very firm.

example.tran: 理查森对公平竞争的明确承诺

example.ex: Yesterday, the message to him was unequivocal: 'Get out.'
example.tran: 昨天，给他的信息很明确：“滚开。”

means.word_mean: 1. admitting of no doubt or misunderstanding; having only one meaning or interpretation and leading to only one conclusion;

sentences.sentence: "the plain and unequivocal language of the laws"- R.B.Taney

auth_sentence.content: The message from the Department of Health is unequivocal.
auth_sentence.res_content: The message from the Department of Health is unequivocal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The message from the Department of Health is unequivocal.

auth_sentence.content: The verification and proof absolutely must be utterly unequivocal.
auth_sentence.res_content: The verification and proof absolutely must be utterly unequivocal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The verification and proof absolutely must be utterly unequivocal.

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Obama has been unequivocal in his public statements.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr. Obama has been unequivocal in his public statements.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr. Obama has been unequivocal in his public statements.
